info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL DARKE, NORTHWESTERN AUGLAIZE AND EASTERN MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 449 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Ottoville to St. Henry, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Celina, Wapakoneta, St. Marys, Coldwater, New Bremen, St. Henry, New Knoxville, Moulton, Mendon, Chickasaw, Burkettsville, Buckland, Montezuma, New Weston, Kossuth, Tama, Rose Hill, Maria Stein, Neptune and State Route 116 at State Route 197. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
